Every intervention in the passage of time reflects what the culture currently values. Deliberate destruction, careful preservation and sanitization, or an allowance of the natural processes of decay, are all choices on what to keep from the relentless beating of time and what to submit to it. Quantum Image Processing.
I will be going over a range of quantum algorithms that will be useful when working with image data, such as algorithms for storing the data, classifying the data, etc.. Alongside the review paper I will be implementing and comparing the algorithms on the toy example below:

The minimum viable product is to build a robust shape detection algorithm for photos shot through a webcam, that can identify sets in the game SET (I have a less robust version currently working, but it requires some decently finicky calibration to the light conditions). 
Then to make the image detection a bit more robust, I was thinking about training a neural network on it, though this would mean I would have to take a bunch of photos in various lighting conditions, etc. From there, we build our way up. Firstly, the current way to identify sets is simply to brute force is, as we're mostly talking 12 choose 3 combinations, sometimes 15 choose 3. 

Now, for the quantum algorithms:
I will be implementing the GQIR algorithm from Wang 2017 which encodes image data into qubits more efficiently than classically possible.

I have yet to find algorithms for pre-processing the data (e.g. gamma correction, color masking, etc.) and for stuff like contour detection.

When the data has been somewhat processed, we then wish to classify it, which could be done using QSVM or a quantum nearest centroid classifier as implemented in Johri 2020.
Finally to pick out the right solutions, I will use Grover's search algorithm, a quantum algorithm which does unordered searches in O(sqrt(n)). While it's obviously a poor use for such a small space to search, I believe I can condense this search down to only using 28 qubits which means I will be able to run it on IBM's state of the art classical simulators, since we simply don't have the hardware to actually run the algorithm for useful problems yet.

As such, in a perfect world, I will have a working product running classically in real time, and a proposed model on how this problem could be efficiently solved given access to a fault-tolerant quantum computer.

If I would like to expand further, I could then choose to teach it other somewhat similar (but a bit harder to computationally solve) games such as Zangle.

The aim of this capstone project is to develop an educational course for the new generations of stock market investors with a goal of democratization of stock market education. These young people do not invest for the long run but rather for a short period of time to gain a good sum of profits. They often consider trading like a ‘game’ and engage in trading these risky market instruments without any knowledge of the financial market or any relevant skills. Last year, a 20-Year-Old Robinhood customer died by suicide after seeing a $730,000 negative balance on his Robinhood trading account (Gara, 2020). He was allowed to over leverage his investment and engaged in risky options trade without any prior education. Because of the rising popularity of day trading and options trading, there are many educators who sell courses online to teach trading. However, these courses cost a lot of money, usually above $1000 but often these online ‘gurus’ turn out to be fake/scam. It is high time, retail-investors become cautious about the consequences of trading high risk market instruments without sufficient knowledge. I believe in the democratization of stock market education because I think achieving financial literacy and financial freedom should be one of the life goals of every person for a prosperous and thriving economy and there should be opportunities in place to achieve these knowledge so that the country can produce a financially literate generation. The stock market is one of the means to increase one’s financial assets and achieve financial independence and hence, anybody who wants to invest or trade by themselves should do proper due diligence by learning about the ins and outs of the stock market. With this belief in heart, I want to design and develop an educational curriculum  on Stock market trading named “The Wolf of MainStreet: The Complete Course on Foundation Stock Trading” which will be made available for helping people to learn about the stock market before trading.

Another article by CNBC discusses the time value of starting investing early for teenagers, which fosters a sense of responsibility among the teenagers that can have a great impact on them. For instance, $100 invested in the S&P 500 would be worth $110 after 1st year and $133 after 3 years if the index gains 10% a year (Booth,2020).
